page.title: 04OLDBURY POWER STATION
page.content: Oldbury has a big Nuclear Power Station five miles from the village. The Power Station has about 600 men employed there some of the villagers work there but most are from outside the village. The Power Station covers an area of 175 acres of land and 380 acres of river bed. When the Power Station was built it affected farmers. They lost lots of land, some farmers had over 100 acres and now have only 50 acres. Oldbury was the third Power Station to be opened on the Severn Estuary and was opened on 10th June, 1969. The Power Station helps in local events and this is appreciated by the villagers.
